conclusion: Analyze the motion of the basketball before and after collision considering air resistance and gravity.
Basketball is dropped from rest at height H; gravitational force is mg; air resistance is lambda mg.
Net force during fall is mg(1 - lambda).
Velocity just before collision is v = sqrt(2g(1 - lambda)H).
Post-collision velocity is ev, where e is the ratio.
Basketball rebounds to height h; net force during ascent is mg(1 + lambda).
Substitute v^2 from fall: e^2(1 - lambda)H = (1 + lambda)h.
Solve for e: e = sqrt((1 + lambda)h / (1 - lambda)H).
Final answer: e = sqrt((1 + lambda)h / (1 - lambda)H).
